subject: Football
Amateur Athletics
lead_paragraph: Cedric Jones, a New England Patriots wide receiver for nine years and an administrator for the N.F.L. for the past 14, yesterday was named the athletic director of the New York Athletic Club. Jones succeeds 84-year-old Ray Lumpp, who is retiring after 47 years. Lumpp began in 1960, the year Jones was born.Jones played for the Patriots from 1982 to 1990. His last position for the N.F.L. was senior director of youth football. Lumpp was an Olympic gold-medal basketball player in 1948 and played five seasons (1948-53) with the Knicks and the Baltimore Bullets.
